intro: Elaphoglossum cedralense, commonly known as the Cedralense holly fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, clustered sporangia on the undersides of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and is often found in areas with high humidity and well-drained soil.
